1.text: For I would not, brethren, have you ignorant, how that our fathers were all under the cloud, and all passed through the sea;

2.text: and were all baptized unto Moses in the cloud and in the sea;

3.text: and did all eat the same spiritual meat;

4.text: and did all drink the same spiritual drink: for they drank of a spiritual rock that followed them: and the rock was Christ.

5.text: Howbeit with most of them God was not well pleased: for they were overthrown in the wilderness.

6.text: Now these things were our examples, to the intent we should not lust after evil things, as they also lusted.

7.text: Neither be ye idolaters, as were some of them; as it is written, The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.

8.text: Neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed, and fell in one day three and twenty thousand.

9.text: Neither let us tempt the Lord, as some of them tempted, and perished by the serpents.

10.text: Neither murmur ye, as some of them murmured, and perished by the destroyer.

11.text: Now these things happened unto them by way of example; and they were written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the ages are come.

12.text: Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he fall.

13.text: There hath no temptation taken you but such as man can bear: but God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that ye are able; but will with the temptation make also the way of escape, that ye may be able to endure it.

14.text: Wherefore, my beloved, flee from idolatry.

15.text: I speak as to wise men; judge ye what I say.

16.text: The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not a communion of the blood of Christ? The bread which we break, is it not a communion of the body of Christ?

17.text: seeing that we, who are many, are one bread, one body: for we all partake of the one bread.

18.text: Behold Israel after the flesh: have not they which eat the sacrifices communion with the altar?

19.text: What say I then? that a thing sacrificed to idols is anything, or that an idol is anything?

20.text: But I say, that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to devils, and not to God: and I would not that ye should have communion with devils.

21.text: Ye cannot drink the cup of the Lord, and the cup of devils: ye cannot partake of the table of the Lord, and of the table of devils.

22.text: Or do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he?

23.text: All things are lawful; but all things are not expedient. All things are lawful; but all things edify not.

24.text: Let no man seek his own, but each his neighbour’s good.

25.text: Whatsoever is sold in the shambles, eat, asking no question for conscience sake;

26.text: for the earth is the Lord’s, and the fulness thereof.

27.text: If one of them that believe not biddeth you to a feast, and ye are disposed to go; whatsoever is set before you, eat, asking no question for conscience sake.

28.text: But if any man say unto you, This hath been offered in sacrifice, eat not, for his sake that shewed it, and for conscience sake:

29.text: conscience, I say, not thine own, but the other’s; for why is my liberty judged by another conscience?

30.text: If I by grace partake, why am I evil spoken of for that for which I give thanks?

31.text: Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God.

32.text: Give no occasion of stumbling, either to Jews, or to Greeks, or to the church of God:

33.text: even as I also please all men in all things, not seeking mine own profit, but the profit of the many, that they may be saved.
